title: COVID-19 is a pandemic: what happens now? - Quora

response.answer_text: You get to hear even more about it in the media. Otherwise nothing. The only thing that can happen now it limiting gatherings, which is occurring. The other thing is quarantining large areas. If the Federal Government declares it a national emergency, it will give the government more power over the citizens.

It’s early days in the pandemic, so: A lot of people are going to get sick.Some of them will die.Eventually, either pretty much everybody who is susceptible will have been infected and either survived or died OR a vaccine will be developed and distributed.In other words, it will be like every other pandemic. Except that this particular virus appears to be more deadly than flu (except the Spanish Flu of 1918), and less deadly than smallpox, which was pandemic for centuries before a vaccine was developed.
